channel.title: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]
channel.description: I have both of my donator capes and they are all ready client sided. My friend has been trying to help me and we still cannot figure it out. If someone could please teach me my msn is satuartperera@hotmail.com. We tried Sainity's Equipment Editor and Item.java. If we were to edit anything in ItemAssistant.java, where and what would i do? I really need help on this. Thanks for your time!

item.title: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

What’s the name of the cape in item.cfg? Putting the name in Item.java HAS to be case sensitive. Meaning you can’t have the name of the item in item.cfg ‘Donator_cape’ and then have Item.java read ‘donator’.

Read full topic
item.source: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]

item.title: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

Try looking for a file called “EquipmentEditor”…

It allows you to edit the slot of an item. All you do is enter the item’s ID and select the slot. Save, compile, and you’re good. If you don’t have a file called EquipmentEditor…then I have no idea.

Read full topic
item.source: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]

item.title: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @www.sagi-x.com www.sagi-x.com
item.description:
@www.sagi-x.com wrote:

It’s Item.java, find public static boolean playerCape(int itemId) {
Underneath it will say:String[] data = { "cloak", "cape", "attractor", "Attractor", "Ava's"
You would change it to:String[] data = { "cloak", "cape", "attractor", "Attractor", "Ava's", "donator"
Or something similar. Unless it’s the models, which i highly doubt.

Read full topic
item.source: Putting my Donator Capes in Cape spot? [PI]
